## spawnPHPWorkerThread() function
spawnPHPWorkerThread<!-- -->(\
&emsp;&emsp;&emsp;<!-- -->backendName<!-- -->: [string](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/2/everyday-types.html#the-primitives-string-number-and-boolean)<!-- -->, \
&emsp;&emsp;&emsp;<!-- -->workerScriptUrl<!-- -->: [string](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/2/everyday-types.html#the-primitives-string-number-and-boolean)<!-- -->, \
&emsp;&emsp;&emsp;<!-- -->config<!-- -->: [WorkerThreadConfig](./php-wasm-browser.workerthreadconfig.md)\
)<!-- -->: [Promise](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise)<!-- -->&lt;[SpawnedWorkerThread](./php-wasm-browser.spawnedworkerthread.md)<!-- -->&gt;

* `backendName` – The Worker Thread backend to use. Either 'webworker' or 'iframe'.
* `workerScriptUrl` – The absolute URL of the worker script.
* `config` – 
* Returns: The spawned Worker Thread.


Spawns a new Worker Thread.
